page.title: 05Ecology east: FINTRY
page.content: Extensive afforestation has formed a distinct habitiat to S and E of upper {Endrick Water,}which is almost gorge-like in places.{ {Carron Valley Forest: Coniferous planatations - spruce, pine some larch, goldcrest, crossbill, redpoll, siskin, short-tailed vole, stoat, fox, roe deer. Elsewhere is wet heath and upland grassland - sundew, sphagnum moss, sedge, cross-leaved heath, heather, mountain hare, grouse. Some base-rich grassland is also found on the steeper slopes and banks of the {River Carron and upper Endrick Water: Riverbank - monkey flower,grey wagtail Pasture - lady's mantle, mole, rabbit. Cliff- broom, gorse, jackdaw. {Carron Valley Reservoir:}Of importance for water fowl - great crested grebe, pochard, whooper swan, cormorant and recently a flock of rare bean geese.
